extracted-table.table-caption: Summary of results comparing μ[Φmax] and the reference metrics.

caption.p: Summary of results comparing μ[Φmax] and the reference metrics.

tr.td: Significant drop: strong dependence on order of points in time-series
Significant drop: strong dependence on order of points in time-series
No significant drop: weak dependence on order of points in time-series
No change: no dependence on order of points in time-series

table-wrap-foot.p: The results of the control procedure and the analysis of modulation in each measure are briefly summarized above. Different aspects of our analysis are given across rows, and the four metrics are presented in the columns.

Different aspects of our analysis are given across rows, and the four metrics are presented in the columns.

extracted-table.table-caption: Contingency table layout for the Markov property test.

caption.p: Contingency table layout for the Markov property test.

table-wrap-foot.p: The following contingency table was constructed to compare the most common three-state sequence to other sequences that share the same states. Rows correspond to a specific three-state sequence. The columns correspond to counts of the three-state sequences and the occurrences of the first two states within them. The values in the table were used to compute a χ2 statistic, which indicated the extent to which the time-series deviates from the Markov property.

Rows correspond to a specific three-state sequence. The columns correspond to counts of the three-state sequences and the occurrences of the first two states within them. The values in the table were used to compute a χ2 statistic, which indicated the extent to which the time-series deviates from the Markov property.
